Frequently Asked Questions
Your go-to resource for answers to common questions about our company, our products, services, and technologies.
Questions and Answers
What is Linde, what does the company do?
In which businesses does Linde operate and what are the applications for its products?
What are Linde's core values?
- We put safety first.
- We are committed to always acting with integrity.
- We are committed to improving the communities where we live and work.
- We embrace inclusion.
- We hold ourselves accountable for our performance, individually and collectively.
Our goal is to ensure that Linde continues to create value for all its stakeholders - whether delivering innovative solutions for our customers, helping the communities where we operate, generating industry-leading returns for our investors, or creating an inspiring workplace for our employees.
How is Linde making our world more productive?
By delivering innovative solutions, technologies and services which make our customers more successful and help to sustain, decarbonize and protect our planet. Our industrial gases and technologies are used in countless applications including production of low-carbon hydrogen and carbon capture systems critical in advancing energy resilience and innovation, life-saving medical oxygen and high-purity and specialty gases for electronics. We also deliver state-of-the-art gas processing solutions to support our customers.
How do Linde's products impact the average consumer?
Our gases, technologies and applications likely impact your life every day, no matter where you call home. They help keep your vegetables fresher, your drive safer and your smartphone smarter. They're used in water, on land, in the air, and even in space.
How does Linde help its customers decarbonize?
At Linde we are actively advancing clean energy projects across diverse sectors and applications - often involving low-carbon hydrogen as today's most practical solution, but also offering clean hydrogen with the lowest carbon intensities. Another prime example for 'doing more with less' is oxy-fuel technology: using pure oxygen instead of natural air is increasing the efficiency of combustion processes, helping to save fuel and emissions.
Industrial decarbonization can boost productivity and enable economic growth. Linde has best-in class technologies and solutions to facilitate cleaner, more efficient, and more sustainable industrial processes. Carbon capture technologies have a critical role to play in decarbonizing our customers' operations. Together with top-tier customers and partners, we are developing CCS projects in the oil & gas, chemical and cement industries.
How does Linde support carbon capture and storage?
Leveraging decades of experience in gas processing and engineering, Linde's innovative carbon capture technologies help reduce emissions. Industries such as cement, chemicals, and steel production are turning to carbon capture technologies to remove CO2 from flue gases, a key step in meeting stringent CO2 emission reduction targets.
How is Linde involved in hydrogen?
Hydrogen is used widely across multiple industries and sectors, such as chemicals and refining - for example hydrogen is already used to desulfurize fuel. Linde is driving innovation across the entire hydrogen value chain to decarbonize industrial plants, refuel hydrogen-powered transport and develop new applications. Discover the latest advancements as Linde leads the transition to cleaner energy solutions for a sustainable future.
How is Linde helping to sustain and protect our planet?
We help customers worldwide improve their environmental performance and reduce their carbon footprint. In fact, Linde helps our clients avoid more than double the emissions that we generate across our entire global footprint. At the same time, we are committed to minimizing our own environmental resource intensity. Linde's climate goals include its 2035 science-based absolute greenhouse gas emissions reduction target and its 2050 climate neutrality ambition. Linde is a participant in the United Nations Global Compact, is a constituent of the FTSE4Good Index and the Dow Jones Best-In-Class Indices (formerly the Dow Jones Sustainability Indices).

Carl von Linde himself travels to the United States to establish Linde Air Products as a subsidiary in the U.S. The business becomes successful and soon attracts additional investors.
In the turmoil of the First World War, Linde loses the United States subsidiary due to expropriation. Linde Air Products becomes part of the newly formed Union Carbide Corporation.
The former Linde division from Union Carbide is spun off as Praxair and goes public. In the subsequent years a couple of major acquisitions strengthen Praxair’s position as one of the top industrial gases businesses in the world.
Praxair acquires Liquid Carbonic, introducing the company to the carbon dioxide market and giving Praxair a full product line of gases. The acquisition also extends Praxair's presence in South America and other geographies.
Linde AG regains the rights to use the brand name Linde to do business in the United States.
Linde acquires the Swedish gases company AGA and therefore expands the business footprint in Northern Europe and South and Middle America.
Praxair acquires Air Liquide’s Germany business serving large customers in the refining, chemical and steel industries via pipeline systems, as well as supplying smaller customers with bulk, medical, specialty and packaged gases.
Linde AG acquires BOC. The Linde Group is formed. The successful Material Handling business is sold and becomes part of KION, which is still using Linde as a brand name.
Linde acquires United States based Lincare, a leading respiratory supplier and also a company with Linde roots.
Praxair acquires NuCO2, the leading provider of beverage carbonation solutions in the United States giving the company opportunity to continue growing the business in the U.S., enhancing distribution efficiency, and extending NuCO2’s offerings to customers in other regions of the world.
Praxair acquires Yara International ASA’s European CO2 business, expanding the company’s presence in resilient end-markets such as food and beverage.
Merger of Equals of Praxair and Linde. To honor the common heritage the combined company is named Linde plc.
Linde completes the sale of non-core business Gist Limited, a temperature-controlled logistics provider, to Marks & Spencer Group plc.
Linde acquires the remaining interests in nexAir, LLC, one of the largest independent packaged gas distributors in the United States with 2022 sales of approximately $400 million.

Advanced Material Technologies
Powering Superior Performance with Advanced Materials
Pushing Boundaries in Tech
Revolutionizing Industry with Superior Innovations
Linde Advanced Material Technologies (AMT) is a leading provider of industry solutions. Our gas-atomized 3D printing metal powders offer unrivaled precision, igniting the additive manufacturing revolution. We've curated a robust portfolio of surface coatings and service applications, adept at combatting corrosion, oxidation, and wear, prolonging the lifespan of critical components. We are committed to excellence, reflected in our electronic division's sputtering targets, designed to deliver consistent sputter performance and extended sputter life through meticulous control over purity and microstructure.
A few highlights:
High-Quality Copper Sputtering Targets, Sustainably Made
Linde is expanding its presence in the copper market as a global manufacturer of Physical Vapor Deposition (PVD) targets, offering the semiconductor industry a wide range of solutions for sputtering the extremely thin films required for microchip production. Being one of the few companies capable of producing materials that meet the semiconductor industry's strict requirements for quality, purity, and consistency, we have invested in a 6N copper refining line to internally produce raw material used to manufacture top-quality copper PVD targets to our customers. Additionally, our refining production line is operated sustainably, as our raw material supplier primarily uses recycled copper, and all process-generated by-products are fully recycled.
Learn more about our variety of sputtering targets.
Chrome-Free Corrosion Coatings for Environmental Benefits
Our wide range of coating materials and application technologies ensures performance equal to or better than hexavalent chrome and cadmium-containing coatings without the associated environmental hazards. Our SERMETELTM chrome-free coating systems protect against corrosion, erosion, and abrasion resistance. Our EXOGARDTM coatings are designed to be an alternative to hard chrome plating and offer superior wear and corrosion protection across all industries.
Learn more about our chrome-free coating materials.
Full-Service Thermal Spray Equipment
Get everything you need for your thermal spray application in one place. Our comprehensive selection includes thermal spray equipment and operational accessories from our TAFATM and GenieTM brands. We also offer maintenance services that you won't find anywhere else.
Metal Powders for Various Applications
Metal Additive Manufacturing (AM) is an increasingly popular advanced technology that offers significant improvements in cost, performance, and a variety of additional benefits. Whether your organization is focused on creating prototypes or mass-producing metal AM components, our range of TRUFORMTM metal powders is suitable for various applications in aerospace, medical, energy, and industrial sectors.
Learn more about our metal powders for additive manufacturing.
Featured Industries:
A reliable supply of high-purity metals and application options to meet growing demands in communications, computing and more.
Lightweight, durable materials that support advanced energy production with greater efficiency and performance.
Materials and processes are designed for repeatable results, for parts that perform as expected run after run.

Linde Engineering
Your Partner for the Production and Processing of Gases
More than 4,000 references demonstrate our ability to innovate gas processing for more sustainable gas production. Based on excellent customer relationships, our service experts also capitalize on digital solutions to take performance to the next level – during the entire plant lifecycle.
A few highlights:
Driving Force for Decarbonization and Efficiency
We empower industry to reach its decarbonization and climate protection goals through a rich portfolio of technologies and services aimed at carbon abatement, early adoption and deployment of emerging technologies and an accelerated transition to cleaner sources of energy. We also have a long tradition of customer and industry engagement geared towards constantly increasing plant efficiency.
Think Hydrogen. Think Linde.
We offer technology for every step in the hydrogen value chain – from source to service. Building on decades of research and countless large-scale projects with innovative hydrogen technologies, we are the partner of choice to drive the energy transition.
Top-to-Bottom Competence – For Your Peace of Mind
LINDE PLANTSERV® experts listen, are trustworthy and always go the extra mile – no matter what it takes. At all stages of the asset lifecycle, our aim is to help you solve your plant management challenges. Building on the vast experience we have gained in engineering over 4,000 plants worldwide, our portfolio combines efficiency- and reliability-enhancing services with digital innovations to take plant performance to the next level.

Our gases, application technologies and expertise in metal fabrication can help increase efficiency and profitability in welding, cutting, heating, joining, additive manufacturing, surface treatment and more.

Our Gases
Linde gases are used across just about every industry and country in the worldA few highlights:
Reducing Waste with Additive Manufacturing
Additive manufacturing, or 3D printing, has the ability to reduce material waste, increase the durability of performance-critical parts, and bring down manufacturing costs. Many factors impact the success of the AM process, including tight control over the atmosphere in the printing chamber. ADDvance® O₂ precision was designed to do just that - and bring AM to new markets and use cases.
Learn more about our AM services
Driving Decarbonization
We are helping to power the decarbonization of public transport by delivering the enabling refueling technologies and hydrogen gas for back-to-base refueling stations such as the RVK reference project in Cologne Germany. By building out the H2 refueling infrastructure with flexible and modular refueling solutions, we are contributing to the accelerated uptake of clean mobility with zero tailpipe emissions.
Learn more about our efforts supporting decarbonization
Promoting More Sustainable Fish Farming
Our energy-efficient oxygenation solutions for land-based aquaculture tanks are helping to meet growing global demand for more sustainable forms of fish farming. Not only does SOLVOX® OxyStream raise the efficiency of land-based fish farming, it also improves living conditions for fish while relieving environmental pressures on coastal regions otherwise home to sea-based fish cages.
Learn more about our oxygenation systems for fish farming
Digitalization in Action
Smart sensors and remote management services from Linde play an important role in helping our customers to ensure uninterrupted gas supplies. DIGIGAS® automatically monitors the gas content in cylinders remotely, giving customers anytime, anywhere access to inventory insights. Improved planning and automated replenishment can create further efficiency gains.
Learn more about our digitalization services

The Audit Committee assists the Board in its oversight of (a) the independence, qualifications and performance of Linde's independent auditor, (b) the integrity of Linde's financial statements, (c) the performance of Linde's internal audit function, and (d) Linde's compliance with legal and regulatory requirements. In furtherance of these responsibilities, the Audit Committee, among other duties:
- appoints the independent auditor to audit Linde's financial statements, approves the fees and terms of such engagement, approves any non-audit engagements of the independent auditor, and meets regularly with, and receives various reports from, the independent auditor. The independent auditor reports directly to the Audit Committee;
- reviews Linde's principal policies for accounting and financial reporting and its disclosure controls and processes, and reviews with management and the independent auditor Linde's financial statements prior to their publication;
- reviews assessments of Linde's internal controls, the performance of the Internal Audit function, the performance evaluations of the General Auditor and the Chief Compliance Officer, and the guidelines and policies by which Linde undertakes risk assessment and risk management; and
- reviews the effectiveness of Linde's compliance, business conduct, integrity and ethics programs.

Procurement
Supplier Guidance and Standards
Our procurement teams worldwide make a significant contribution to the performance of Linde and are accountable for the definition and implementation of the overall procurement strategy. Sourcing activities are organized through effective global category management which monitors suppliers and market developments and aggregates Linde's global demand into multinational supply contracts. Our goals and strategies are fully aligned with the respective business functions, and our guidelines and standards regarding quality and safety are embedded in our day-to-day activities and sourcing decisions.
Global Terms and Conditions
This should serve as a general orientation for Linde's approach to terms and conditions of purchase. Please reach out to your local business contact for the adapted terms and conditions that apply in your country.
Supplier Code of Conduct
The Supplier Code of Conduct defines Linde's most essential requirements for our Suppliers concerning their responsibilities towards Linde and its stakeholders, their employees, societies, and the environment. Linde’s procurement team receives training on topics covered in the Supplier Code of Conduct and is responsible for communicating Linde's requirements to Suppliers.
Download the Supplier Code of Conduct
The Supplier Code of Conduct is also available in several other languages. Please view and select from the multiple language versions.
Conflict-Free Materials Supply Policy
This policy covers our expectations to suppliers or potential suppliers of conflict minerals or other materials, and their sub-suppliers, to only source materials from environmentally and socially responsible sources and be conflict-free.
Supplier Tender Portal
We use a Supplier Tender Portal known as Pactum that is designed to simplify and streamline how we work and communicate with our suppliers across various Linde geographies and business segments.

Supplier Tender Portal
Pactum: Our Gateway for Efficient Supplier Collaboration
The platform provides an intuitive environment for managing selected procurement demands. Our interactive chatbot guides you as a supplier through each step of the process, ensuring a smooth and user-friendly experience.
Invitation-Based Participation
Suppliers are invited via email to participate in relevant tenders based on their profile, capabilities, and existing business relationship with Linde.
Once invited, you receive a notification containing all necessary details to access the portal and submit your final proposal.
To ensure smooth operation, please make sure your systems can receive emails from the domain: @procurement.linde.com
We sincerely appreciate your commitment to supporting our procurement processes. Your collaboration plays a vital role in building a resilient and sustainable supply chain in Linde.

Water is not a great conductor of electricity. So, to ensure an energy-efficient process, electrolytes are used instead. Electrolysis technologies differ according to the type of electrolyte used. Currently, the two main technologies are alkaline and PEM (Proton Exchange Membrane) - both of which can deliver high pure hydrogen on-site and on-demand.
Alkaline
Alkaline electrolysis is a very well-established technology that uses two electrodes separated by a porous diaphragm and a liquid alkaline solution as the electrolyte. The electrolyte solution allows hydroxide ions to be transported between the electrodes to form oxygen and hydrogen but is not consumed during the reaction.
This technology is considered as extremely efficient, reliable, and cost-effective. Capacity can stack in the MW range but drawbacks include using corrosive liquid electrolytes, operation at low current densities and low pressures as well as gas crossover. Linde has installed over 80 Alkaline electrolyzers globally.
Proton Exchange Membrane (PEM)
PEM electrolysis uses pure water and a solid polymer electrolyte instead of a liquid solution. The electricity splits the water into hydrogen and oxygen. Hydrogen protons pass through the membrane, combining with electrons to form H2 gas on the cathode side.
PEM electrolyzers are well suited for use with volatile renewable energy sources thanks to their fast ramp-up/down capabilities and their wide dynamic operating range. No corrosive electrolyte is involved, and they operate at high current density which speeds up the breakdown of the water molecule, ultimately affecting production price. Finally, a small footprint and compact system design is a benefit for many on-site industrial applications.
Whatever the technology type, electrolyzers are always described in terms of their capacity. This represents the maximum operation power and so is measured in Watts (or MW, GW). The higher the wattage, the more hydrogen that electrolyzer can potentially produce.
For example, if it takes 50kWh of energy to produce 1 kg of hydrogen, a 10 MW electrolyzer will produce 200 kg in an hour (10,000 / 50) while a 20 MW electrolyzer could produce 400 kg in the same time. Individual cells can be stacked in modules to increase the capacity of any one electrolyzer: a valuable flexible feature for scaling up industrial applications.

The compression unit is the key component of a hydrogen refueling station. It compresses H2 stored at low pressure to up to 100 MPa. The ideal compression technology depends on a range of factors, such as the initial state of the hydrogen (gaseous or liquid), the station throughput and the type of vehicle to be fueled. Linde offers dedicated compression systems for the most varied requirements. Our proprietary, patented ionic compressor and cryo pump offer reliability, low maintenance and high energy efficiency.

Converting the Natural Gas Grid for Hydrogen Delivery
Hydrogen Injection: Converting Pipedreams to Reality
Hydrogen (H2) has the potential to play a key role in connecting different infrastructure layers in a low- or zero-carbon economy. Looking beyond its conventional applications as an industry feedstock in refining and fertilizer production, it is increasingly being heralded as a way to unlock the potential of renewable energy. In simple terms, surplus solar and wind energy can be converted to hydrogen and then to electricity on demand. Or it can be used to power zero-emissions fuel cell vehicles. The question is, how can hydrogen be efficiently delivered to the point of use in large quantities? To date, the market has been deterred by the high costs that would be involved in building a dedicated hydrogen pipeline or delivery infrastructure.
The good news is that the infrastructure is already in place. With a few adjustments, H2 can be injected into existing natural gas pipelines and delivered to a wide range of end-point applications. The separation and purification technologies required downstream to extract hydrogen from the pipeline or natural gas blend are already available.
Proven PSA expertise
This delivery solution combines Linde's market-leading pressure swing adsorption (PSA) technologies with a custom-designed membrane/permeation technology developed in collaboration with Evonik Industries. Made from hollow fiber, the HISELECT® membranes enable hydrogen to be extracted from natural gas blends at concentrations of up to 90%. Our proven PSA technologies then increase the purity to above 99.9999%. Having already engineered over 900 adsorption plants worldwide, including more than 500 H2 PSA plants, Linde builds on decades of experience in adsorption technologies to deliver the world's highest capacities and on-stream availability levels.
This innovative, ready-to-use concept will be demonstrated at our Dormagen real-scale plant near Düsseldorf in Germany.
